[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/hash.rs] [Function: zero()] [Initialization Attack] Can an attacker force transaction hashes or state roots to become zero hash through integer overflow or cryptographic weaknesses? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/hash.rs] [Function: zero()] [Comparison Edge Cases] Do equality checks properly handle zero hash, or can it cause false positives when comparing uninitialized vs intentionally zeroed hashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/hash.rs] [Struct: HashValue] [Event Handle Collision] Can event handle hashes collide, allowing attackers to overwrite or intercept events from other smart contracts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/api/types/src/hash.rs] [Struct: HashValue] [Module ID Collision] If used for Move module identification, can hash collisions allow deploying malicious code under legitimate module identities? (Critical)
